block.comment:
Raven Aerostar data demonstration
FE simulator demo UART in, USB Out RECEIVE data from the Future Engineers simulator over UART (RX pin) ECHO (PRINT) the data back to the serial monitor (USB) CALCULATE a balloon status based on change in time and altitude SHOW status based on event string with neopixels
Requires a USB to TTL (UART) device like this USB to TTL Serial Cable: https://www.adafruit.com/product/954
Connect the Tx wire (green wire on the USB to TTL Serial cable) to the RX pad on the Circuit Playground Express Connect the Ground wire (black wire on the USB to TTL Serial cable) to the GND (ground) pad on the Circuit Playground Express
# Declare FE_sim_data object, provider argument must be supplied: sim_data = FE_sim_data.FESimData(provider='up_aerospace')
# at the top of the loop, run the update() method for the FE_sim_data object sim_data.update()
# check if the data is currently streaming... if sim_data.streaming:
if sim_data.new_data: # print the data to the serial monitor print(sim_data.data)
Raven's data set does not include events. This example uses altitude and time to find a slope value which is interpreted as Ascend, float, and descend
Data Packet Contents:
INDEX 0... ...INDEX 4 [timestamp, latitude, longitude, altitude-m, pressure-kpa]
DO NOT USE sim_data.event! There are no event codes on a Raven flight!
Written by Arnold Martin for Future Engineers

SPDX-FileCopyrightText: 2021 Future Engineers LLC
SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
setup FE_sim_data object for raven aerostar balloon flight
declare neopixels to visualize events
read the serial data from FE_sim_data object
check if the data is streaming
data is streaming, check for a new packet
there is a new packet, let's make a local copy of it
let's print the whole data packet
get the time stamp of the data packet
figure the change in time since the last packet
save this_time for next time!
now let's get an altitude value to determine rising, floating or falling!
figure the change in altitude since the last packet
save this_alt for next time
finally with both delta_t and delta_alt we can calculate slope!

with data collected and slope calculated we can now determine if the balloon is rising, floating or falling
slope at float is between -0.5 and 0.5 slope at rise is greater than 2.0 slope at descent is less than -4.0
check for slope values in a large range to filter out data anomalies then determine the status of the balloon based on the alt_slope value
print the status
data is not streaming reset time, alt and status variables
use the determined status to fill the pixel leds with colors
